body_html:
@ebrevdo I use a model of multiplicative lstm instead of basiclstm. Do you still want the metagraph & checkpoint in python2?
@xisnu I guess the problem lies not only in reading checkpoint values, but also in storing. I have checked the values stored in python3, everything is right. I shall check the values stored in python2, and see the difference between the two.

body:
@ebrevdo I use a model of multiplicative lstm instead of basiclstm. Do you still want the metagraph & checkpoint in python2?
@xisnu I guess the problem lies not only  in reading checkpoint values, but also in storing. I have checked the values stored in python3, everything is right. I shall check the values stored in python2, and see the difference between the two.
